Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder section of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is lightly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a red-brown slip, cream painted horizontal bands and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394337) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394337)
